channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Who Is Ibrahim Aqeel, the Hezbollah Commander Targeted by Israel?
item.description: The senior leader, who survived multiple assassination attempts, has been sought by the United States for bombings in the 1980s. Here is a closer look...

item.title: Live Updates: Israel Targets Senior Hezbollah Leader in Beirut Airstrike
item.description: The United States had accused the leader, Ibrahim Aqeel, of involvement in bombings that killed hundreds in 1983. Israel said he was killed in Friday’...

item.title: Olive Garden’s parent company is betting on a new deal with Uber to revive its pasta empire
item.description: The restaurant operator plans to offer nationwide delivery for Olive Garden through a two-year partnership with Uber.

item.title: GE Vernova May Cut 900 Offshore Wind Jobs as It Scales Back
item.description: The company, a spinoff from General Electric, has been plagued by financial losses in its wind unit and, more recently, accidents involving the failur...

item.title: Israel’s Attacks on Hezbollah Have Intensified but Stop Short of All-Out War
item.description: Israel is attempting a risky strategy, increasing the intensity of its attacks in an attempt to force Hezbollah to back down, while raising the chance...

item.title: Disney says most of its business will stop using Slack by the end of the year
item.description: A hacktivist group called NullBulge leaked data from almost 10,000 of Disney’s Slack channels in July.

item.title: Now That Rates Are Falling, Let’s Turn to Other Matters
item.description: The Federal Reserve has at last cut interest rates but our columnist points out a host of concerns that could weigh on financial markets.

item.description: The senior leader, who survived multiple assassination attempts, has been sought by the United States for bombings in the 1980s. Here is a closer look...

item.title: Renters want pet areas, air filtration systems, and happy hours: Zillow
item.description: “Listings with a turfed pet area, coworking space, or community happy hours are drawing more interest as renters appear to be prioritizing practical a...

item.title: F.T.C. Accuses Drug Middlemen of Inflating Insulin Prices
item.description: The case takes aim at the major pharmacy benefit managers, agency officials said, claiming that they favored more expensive insulin products and force...

item.title: Europe’s New Defense Chief: ‘A King Without a Kingdom’?
item.description: The European Union has vowed to enhance its military capability. But money is scarce, responsibilities overlap and the new job is less about soldiers ...

item.title: Trump Media nosedives to record low on the first day Trump and other insiders can sell their shares
item.description: The company has lost more than half of its value since Kamala Harris entered the race.

item.title: Harris Has a Polling Edge in Wisconsin, but Democrats Don’t Trust It
item.description: The vice president, who is visiting the state on Friday, has led Donald Trump there more often than not. Yet nearly everyone in Wisconsin politics bel...

item.title: Harrods Will Be Sued by Mohamed al-Fayed’s Alleged Victims, Lawyers Say
item.description: Attorneys for 37 women said they would sue Harrods, the luxury department store, over the rape and sexual assault they say its former owner committed.

item.title: Microsoft strikes deal to reopen Three Mile Island, site of the worst nuclear accident in U.S. history, to power its AI data centers
item.description: Company plans to use plant’s undamaged reactor to power its AI data centers.
